Tracy Taylor-Turner

![Tracy Taylor-Turner](https://auburnwa.gov/UserFiles/Servers/Server_11470554/Image/City%20Hall/City%20Councilmembers/Tracy_Vert.jpg)Tracy Taylor Turner is a 6-time Emmy-nominated and Edward R. Murrow Award–winning TV and radio reporter who spent more than two decades telling stories in the Seattle market.

She now serves as the Communications Coordinator for the City of Kent, where she brings her deep media experience and passion for community engagement to public service.

Tracy’s commitment to giving back runs deep. She spent 14 years serving on the Seattle Animal Shelter Foundation Board, is a brand ambassador for the See Ya Later Foundation, and actively supports Hearts for Doxies Dog Rescue as a volunteer and foster family. She currently serves on the Sound Cities Association’s Regional Transit committee, Economic Development District Board, and the Valley Regional Fire Authority Board.

A proud Auburn resident, Tracy understands the value of strong local services and programs. She’s a former City of Auburn Arts Commissioner, a devoted wife to her husband Kyle, and a proud bonus mom to her 18-year-old daughter.  
In her free time, Tracy enjoys volunteering, connecting with friends, and traveling with her family.

CONTACT:  
Tracy Taylor-Turner  
c/o City of Auburn  
25 West Main Street  
Auburn, WA 98001  
253-308-5171 (p)  
253-288-3132 (f)  
[Email Tracy Taylor-Turner](mailto:ttaylor@auburnwa.gov) (e)

Current term began: January 1, 2024  
Current term ends: December 31, 2027
